title: (x) 80s type ID? / seperate monolinear script - Harlow {Mark S}
content:
Hi there,  
Anyone knows what this type is? (The one at the "Summer Megamix" part)

[http://4.bp.blogspot.com/\_HvCNHaaadrI/SxBCis9vCPI/AAAAAAAAHGQ/5sJNiSXcbG...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017045830/http:/4.bp.blogspot.com/_HvCNHaaadrI/SxBCis9vCPI/AAAAAAAAHGQ/5sJNiSXcbGs/s1600/boneym20.jpg "http://4.bp.blogspot.com/\_HvCNHaaadrI/SxBCis9vCPI/AAAAAAAAHGQ/5sJNiSXcbGs/s1600/boneym20.jpg")

Thank you in advance!
author: icantgetenough

comments.content:
I isolated the letters of the type in the linked image in Photoshop and saved them back as a JPG. Then using teh "WhatTheFont" tool at MyFonts.com, I found one font with four possible weights/variants for it:

1. [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/harlow-sh/solid-regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017045830/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/harlow-sh/solid-regular/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/harlow-sh/solid-regular/") - Harlow Solid SH Regular  
2. [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/harlow/solid/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017045830/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/harlow/solid/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/harlow/solid/") - Harlow ICG Solid  
3. [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/harlow/solid/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017045830/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/harlow/solid/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/harlow/solid/") - Harlow Solid  
4. [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/harlow/solid-plain/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017045830/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/harlow/solid-plain/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/harlow/solid-plain/") - Harlow Solid Plain

From what I can see, they're a pretty close fit. Unfortunately, they're not a exact fit since the image's font has a very clean cut to the edges and ends of the letters while Harlow is very rounded.

Maybe someone else can find a better match. :)

Edit: Looks like Mark and I found the same thing. Though comparing the two, Harlow's rounded while the original's font isn't.
The "Solid" style is rounded, the outline/shadow version isn't.
Ah, you're right. I didn't even check the outline/shadow version.
thanks a lot guys. that was really fast and helpful. bless x
